column4: i was trying to enable my nvidia graphic driver and it now it wont let me boot up. the last command that i run was sudo nvidia-xonfig
erealz:but if i remove them then ill go back again :S
i was trying to enable my nvidia graphic driver and it now it wont let me boot up. the last command that i run was sudo nvidia-xonfig
why didn't you install nvidia with the Hardware Drivers program
do you get an error or anything now when you start ubuntu
can you get to a console? (ctrl+alt+f1)
try this on command line - "cat /etc/X11/xorg.conf | pastebinit"
ok then... try this... "cat /etc/X11/xorg.conf | curl -F 'sprunge=<-' http://sprunge.us"
what happens if you do "sudo modprobe nvidia"
ok then the problem is you don't have the nvidia driver
i can see some nvidia thing :P
let me see.... "dpkg -l  | grep nvidia | curl -F 'sprunge=<-' http://sprunge.us"
anyway you could delete /etc/X11/xorg.conf and then you will be able to boot and install the nvidia driver
